intro: Tournefortia brasiliensis, commonly known as Brazilian starfruit, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruits. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a glossy surface, while the flowers are showy with five petals. The fruit, which resembles a star, is edible and has a sweet, tangy flavor.
